courses.title: The Art of Blender

objectives: You will learn how to become a proficient modeller using Blender, a free to use 3D modelling program.

courses.description:
This course has been created and tested up to Blender 4.4 and we’ll continue to update it as and when new versions of Blender is released. Learn from the ground up, how to create AAA assets using Blender, a free to use 3D modelling program. You'll learn it's feature set, and then build a simple scene applying the knowledge you have learned. Build a structure using modular pieces, create props, add lighting, sculpt a small piece of landscape and add a camera. Then render your work to a final image that you can add to your portfolio.
Whether you are a budding game artist, a FX artist, a texture artist, or you simply want to print your own models using a 3D printer, Blender can do that for you.
Whatever your goals are…


Build and create models, and texture assets for video games.
Level Designer creating grey box levels
Create 3D prints for yourself or as a gift.
Design your dream garden, extension, or kitchen for your house.
Maybe you’re a traditional artist wondering what all this 3D noise is all about and how it can help you (it really can).
Or maybe you simply want to experiment with 3D art for pleasure.
The course follows a flow that will teach you the core feature set in Blender, and then use those tools in a project that can be shared with renders at the end. Assets will be supplied where required, and I show you where you can obtain free assets to help you with your scene building. I do expect you to put the work in, it's the best way to learn, so I don't give you all the assets, you actually have to make them using what you learn.
With a total enrolment of over 18,000 (at the time of writing) across all of my courses, you can be sure that you are in good hands with The ART of Blender. I have over 30 years of experience working in the games industry, and continue to do so, so I have a fountain of knowledge to share with you. If it isn’t in the course, simply ask and I will endeavour to create it and add lectures as and when required.
Sign up now. You won't be disappointed!
New Videos added due to Blender 4.4 release (July 2025).

2D Artists curious about 3D modelling and what it can do.
Anybody who wants to print thier own 3D models.

courses.description:
Uma das técnicas mais utilizadas para a produção gráfica de jogos é a pixel art, que encanta todo jogador, pela sua simplicidade, cores e charme.
E diferente do que muitos pensam, a pixel art não ficou presa ao passado, tanto é que atualmente temos diversos jogos modernos que utilizam a estética da pixel art.
Porém, criar uma boa pixel art, é um desafio maior do que se pensa e aprender as técnicas da pixel art de forma correta, ou seja, de uma forma que qualquer pessoa consiga aprender e aplicar, pode ser uma tarefa árdua e você pode acabar se perdendo neste caminho, ou até já tenha se perdido.
E é justamente por isso que preparei este curso, para que qualquer pessoa, mesmo os iniciantes possam aprender e dominar as técnicas de pixel art, sem grandes dificuldades, através de truques, dicas e macetes que muitos artistas escondem da maioria das pessoas.
Meu nome é Jeferson Dias, sou artista visual, desenvolvedor de jogos e neste
curso eu te ensinarei, passo a passo e de forma prática, desde os primeiros passos, começando pelas técnicas de desenho de linhas, curvas e círculos em pixel art.
Também estudaremos sobre cores, como trabalhar com paletas reduzidas, escolher as cores de forma correta e fazer simplificações.
Você entenderá como funciona as luzes e sombras, assim como representa-las em pixel art.
Em seguida, te ensinarei diversas técnicas para aprimorar suas habilidades de desenho em pixel art, para que você seja capaz de desenhar qualquer coisa que você queira.
E claro, não vamos deixar os cenários de fora, pois trarei um módulo completo ensinando a criar tilesets de diferentes estilos, para montar diferentes tipos de cenários, seja para jogos de plataforma ou até mesmo rpg.
E seguindo esta temática, também temos um módulo focado na criação de backgrounds para jogos, feitos em diferentes camadas para a aplicação do famoso efeito parallax.
Depois falaremos sobre design de personagens e como criar personagens que se encaixem na história do jogo de forma correta.
Também temos um módulo inteiro ensinando técnicas de animação, onde você aprenderá os conceitos básicos de quadros de animação, aceleração e desaceleração, como animar elementos de cenário, animação de personagens em diferentes ações, começando das animações mais simples até chegarmos nas mais complexas.
Este é um módulo que vai desmistificar a animação e levará a qualidade do seu trabalho para outro patamar.
E por último, ensinarei a criar animações de efeitos, onde você aprenderá a animar partículas de luz, fumaça, fogo etc.
E não se engane, pois animar efeitos é mais complexos do que se imagina e por isso eu preparei métodos e técnicas que facilitarão o seu processo de compreensão e animação de efeitos.
Este curso é composto por mais de 170 aulas, mais de 40 horas de conteúdo para que você aprenda pixel art do básico ao avançado através de uma metodologia de ensino que permite que qualquer pessoa possa dominar a pixel art sem grandes dificuldades, sendo que algumas técnicas eu mesmo desenvolvi para meu uso pessoal, e agora estou passando elas para você.
Então não perca esta oportunidade única de se matricular! e venha comigo aprender pixel art.

courses.description:
Why this course is special


This course is like no other on the market. We're going to be looking at some very interesting concepts when it comes to Narrative Design.


My Guarantee
For every student that joins the course, they will be able to ask questions about their games and how to go about using their story to help develop their game. I will be available to answer any and all questions for all of my students.


The Course Structure
The course is almost all videos. It will take between 6.5 hours to complete. After you finish this course, you will have a more robust understanding of how to write for your games.
The course is structured into 8 main Sections.
Section 2: Introduction to Narrative Design
In this section, We will be taking a solid look at what is narrative design. Understanding all the fundamentals that go into writing and grasp a deep comprehension of plot theory. We will also look at game genres, player archetypes, mechanics, clarity in writing, and much more.


Section 3: Concept / Pitch
Here, we look at how to generate and cultivate ideas from their initial inception to writing out a full-blown pitch document. This section allows you to create your concept that will be pushed throughout the entire course.


Section 4: World Building
This is my favorite section because here, we will look at the intricacies of building a full-scale world from nothing. We will talk about climate, mood, setting, who inhabits it, is it fantasy, is it science fiction and much more


Section 5: Character
In this section, we flesh out our main protagonist and give them a sense of purpose in the out newly created world. This will allow us to see which of the 4 main types of character we want to create/. We when looking at Character Psychology and the 16 personality types, along with really looking at diversity in video games and how to make it more efficient


Section 6: Story
This section is dedicated to player agency, giving the player a sense of purpose throughout the entire game and respecting their choices. We take a critical look at Linear, Non-Linear and open-world games and their perspective on player agency.


Section 7: Dialogue
Here we will look at dialogue and the importance it represents in-game. How to write dialogue, the 3 main types, and incorporating cutscenes into the game.


Section 8: Bringing it all together
This section brings all previous sections together to understand the fundamentals of narrative design


Section 9: Bonus: Breaking into the industry as a Narrative Designer
In this Bonus Section, we take a look at what tools are at a Narrative Designer's disposal to break into the industry and start their careers right after finishing this course
Certification of completion when finishing this course
When you complete 100% of the videos in this course, you will be emailed a certificate of completion by Udemy so you can show it as proof of your expertise and that you have completed a certain number of hours of instruction in the course topic.

requirements: Basic knowledge of Zbrush, 3ds Max, Substance Painter, and Photoshop
courses.description:
Instructor Info
Manuel Rondon is currently working as a professional 3D artist and part time instructor. He loves both jobs because they allow him to work on what he is passionate about while still having some creative freedom. His advice for students who are just starting out and want to make it in the industry is to be knowledgeable and be open to different areas of 3D art as this can give you more opportunities for jobs. As you gain more experience, you can then specialize in characters, textures, or animations but in the beginning, it's best to wear as many hats as possible.
Course Info
In this course, you will be taken from start to finish on how to create a female character for video games in a stylized format. We will start by looking at reference photos, were we will plan our whole project. We will analyze the photos, determine our color choices, style and silhouette and the path we will take to create the concept that we want at the end. We will move on to sculpting our high poly and this process will be done using ZBrush. You will learn tips and techniques on building a female character and mistakes that you might run across and how to correct them. After sculpting, we will take our high poly mesh into 3ds Max to retopologize our character. You will learn how to create a low poly version of the character so it can work inside a game engine. Then we will proceed to unwrap our low poly mesh from the full body of the character to each and every armor and prop the character is sporting. After unwrapping, we will go through the method of texturing in a stylized way to achieve the cartoon look that you see in video games such as Overwatch and Sunset Overdrive. To finalize the course, we will go inside Marmoset Toolbag to prepare a nice looking render of our work for our portfolio.

courses.description:
Asepriteをこれからはじめて触る方のためのドット絵超初心者用講座です。
ピクセルアート（ドット絵）知識ゼロ、Aseprite使用経験ゼロの状態から「短期間」で基本操作をマスターできます。
さらに、カンタンな「作例」をつくることができます。
ピクセルアート作品に加えて、ドット絵が動く「アニメ作品」も作成できるようになります。


ピクセルアートとはドット絵のことです。ドット絵とは、このような細かい点で作られたイラストのことです。


昔のゲーム画面はドット絵で作られてました。近年、このドット絵がおもしろい、かわいい、芸術性があるということで、「ピクセルアート」として再評価されて人気です。
日本でもゲーム作品でリアルな3DCGではなく、かわいいドット絵が採用される作品が人気です。
例えば「テラリア」などもドット絵でつくられています。
ドット絵はペインターなど、どんなソフトでも作れます。
エクセルで作ることもできます。
しかし、本格的にピクセルアートに取り組むなら「Aseprite」が最もおすすめです。
Asepriteはドット絵作成に特化して開発された専門のソフトです。ピクセルパーフェクトや、アニメ作成用のフレーム機能がカンタンに使えます。
機能もドット絵のために特化されているので、余計なものがなくマスターしやすいソフトです。
Asepriteの使い方は日本語解説がほとんどないので、これから使ってみたい方のために、わかりやすくAsepriteの使い方を噛み砕いて解説しました。


まずAsepriteの基本的な使い方を解説しました。
そして、一通り使い方を学習したら実際にドット絵作品をつくれるという流れの講座に仕上げました。


初心者が今すぐトライできる「カンタンで小さいもの」から作例をご用意しました。
また、Asepriteは「ドット絵」を「アニメ」にすることができますので、アニメを作るレクチャーもご用意しました。
カンタンでシンプルな作例をマネしてAsepriteを使った「ドット絵アニメ」の作成にも挑戦いただけます。


最後までこの講座をやり遂げることで、Asepriteを使ったドット絵作成の基礎基本が身につきます。
あなただけの「オリジナル作品」作りのスタートにお役立てください。


それでは本講座でお待ちしております。
target_audience: Asepriteでドット絵（ピクセルアート）をはじめたい初心者の方

courses.description:
If you're new to Unreal, or want to get started creating highly detailed and professional outdoor landscapes, then you've come to the right place!
In this course I'll teach you all the amazing tools in UE5 that can be utilized to create levels and landscapes, and we'll put that knowledge to use by creating an entire island level, step by step!
---------------------------
If you don't have any experience in Unreal Engine 4, or 5, I've got you covered!  I've dedicated part of this course to teaching the basic knowledge needed to complete this course.  You'll learn how to install the engine, how to add objects to your new projects, and even how to navigate the engine and edit levels!
Once you learn the basics, or if you already have some experience, we'll hop into learning all of UE5s landscape tools!  I'll teach you how to sculpt terrain, by going in depth into all the parameters available in the engine, as well as how to create a custom landscape material that we'll use to paint highly detailed textures onto our island.  I'll even show you how to paint realistic foliage onto your levels.
But we won't just stop after having created our island!  I'll even show you how to implement some of UE5s realistic water system, and how to set the mood of your scene with lighting, post processing, fog, and volumetric clouds.
After that, I'll even teach you how to make your level playable by customizing object collision, and adding invisible walls to keep players on the right path.
target_audience: Beginner to intermediate game developers who want to make high-end landscapes and outdoor levels

Olá Eu sou o Dado Almeida,

Esse é o Curso de Design & Criação de Personagens
Desenhar personagens é o que mais gosto de fazer. Como vocês, Eu cresci interessado em Games, Desenhos e Cultura Pop.
Hoje, Eu trabalho com isso todos os dias, e crio personagens para Jogos, Ilustrações e Animações 3D.
Com experiência prática dessa indústria Eu acho que agora é um bom momento para compartilhar o que aprendi e sei que funciona de verdade.

Esse novo curso é dividido em duas partes:
Na primeira, Eu explico e mostro as idéias de design que você pode usar pra melhorar qualquer desenho.
São conceitos importantes, especialmente pra quem aprende a desenhar sozinho e precisa de idéias pra melhorar a Arte pessoal.
Na segunda parte o foco é mostrar o processo de Criação de um personagem, do começo ao fim.
Eu vou te ensinar todas as etapas, do briefing à entrega da Arte Final.

Cada passo com explicações e comentários sobre os Porquês de cada decisão. É como se a aula fosse aqui no meu estúdio.
No final, quem desenha só por hobby e para projetos pessoais vai conhecer ferramentas para deixar os personagens mais interessantes e dinâmicos.


Mas se além disso você procura trabalhar como Designer de Personagens, o conteúdo do curso é um atalho para produzir um portfólio sólido, com um tipo de arte que realmente mostra sua técnica e capacidade de invenção.
Agora é com você.
Inscreva-se, planeje seus estudos e comece a desenhar.
Eu realmente espero que você goste e aproveite esse meu novo curso.
É isso ai.

- Dado

¿Eres Estudiante, profesional o aficionado y aspiras a convertirte en artista digital? y quieres fortalecer habilidades para la creación de personajes 3d en la industria del Cine, Animación digital y Videojuegos?. Si tu respuesta es si, este curso es para tí!

A través de mas de 50 clases podrás aprender el proceso industrial de creación de personajes 3D, poner en práctica tus conocimientos en anatomía y recordar los conceptos base. courses.description:
-- UPDATE - Warrior girl character blueprint added upon request!



What makes a good game?

A good game needs a great story. It needs nice overall graphics. Engaging gameplay.
And it also needs well designed characters!

This course is exactly about that! When you are developing your own game, and you are not a designer, you will find creating a hero for your game challenging!

During the course we learn

the theory of character design
what makes a good character
my 6 step character design method
to create a character sheet
to prepare our characters for animation
to animate our characters

And we will do all this in Inkscape, this epic free software! It is a very versatile vector tool, which makes designing characters much more easier and faster!

Apart of the above, I will share character blueprints with you! These are showing how I design a character with Inkscape from scratch. We practice different skills with each character. We create character sheet from one, and basic animation from the other.

The characters we will create:
a simple and cute robot character - great for kids
a black ninja warrior - simple and smooth
a heavy rpg warrior - a real tank!
a  fantasy skeleton warrior - cute but deadly
NEW! a warrior girl - ready to fight!

Your task will be to practice and create character sheet and basic animation for all the characters, or your very own game hero/enemy!

I will also share tips and tricks in the course. In these short lessons I usually want to help you to work faster and create better designed figures.

Mind that this is only the first version of the course! I will add several new character blueprints - and listen to the need of my students - and I will keep the course updated.

I don't want to talk about myself. If you want to know me better, read my instructor bio. But I can tell you one thing: I am here to teach. When you ask me, I will help and will find a solution to your problem the best I can!
target_audience: Do you need a unique character for your new game? This course is for you!

courses.description:
Instructor Info
Leo Li is currently working as a Concept Artist in Ubisoft and had worked on games such as Far Cry Primal and Watch Dogs 2.  He had also completed his own personal comic book which contains 160 color illustration pages and took him years to make for his company Creative Gear Design. His all time favorite game is The Witcher 3 and Assassin's Creed because he found the storytelling and lighting amazing and truly breathtaking. He also love to watch movies that show great cinematography, storytelling and interesting composition and design elements. His favorite movies are Blade Runner, Perfume, Raging Bull, and The Untouchables. His advice for students just starting out in the industry is to respect and try ways to interact with the artists who had valuable experience and learn from them. requirements: Playing video games, even as a casual player
courses.description:
From what end should you start designing a video game?


The correct answer is to define its gameplay first.
But how to proceed?


A game system is like a complex clockwork, with many components interacting with each other. Designing a solid game system can be daunting.
However, each component is simple to understand, and if you know how to design them, you can build a coherent and effective game system.


In this class, I will teach you how to make the critical choices for each component:


What are the key components you need to design?
What are the fundamental rules you must follow to design them?
In which order should you design them to build a coherent game system?


I use plenty of examples to help you understand the concepts.
To help you design your game, I  provide exercises and a unique tool: A checklist to ensure you ask the right questions and don’t forget key aspects of a solid game system.


What I will share with you is based on my 29+ years of experience as a game designer. I worked as the lead designer on numerous home consoles and mobile games: Alone In The Dark - The New Nightmare, two Splinter Cell games, Wanted - Weapons of Fate, Fighters Uncaged, etc. I was also a design consultant for some of the most professional studios and publishers: Activision, DICE, Sony, Pixel Federation, and Bohemia Interactive.


By the end of this class, you will know how to design your gameplay and a game system.

courses.description:
If you play localized games, this probably sounds familiar…
You’re playing your favorite game on a rainy winter afternoon. “Cool graphics! Amazing playability! Killer music! Stunning action! Wait a minute… What’s with all the spelling mistakes? That text doesn’t make sense! Who on earth translated this game!? I could’ve done a better job myself!”
Engage players in the game story
Learn the basic concepts behind game localization and specialize as a game translator, linguistic tester or game localization project manager.


Here’s what you’ll learn:
Stages of the game localization process
Introduction to game internationalization, the game translation process, different review methods, the importance of linguistic testing. Examine the challenges you’ll face in each stage and decide which part of the process you’d like to work on!


Differences between working in-house and as a freelancer
Learn how to get acquainted with the game you’ll be translating, what reference material looks like, how to report queries, and examine general rates and salaries before you establish your own. Compare pros and cons, and select your ideal lifestyle!


The technical aspects
Get a handle on translating texts with codes, conquer those dreaded variables and learn how not to exceed character limitations. All with real examples and plenty of practical exercises! Spend more time translating and less worrying about technical issues!


Translation and transcreation
Translating a game is nothing like translating software, laws or contracts. It’s actually great fun! (That’s the brotherhood’s best kept secret: you’ll get paid for doing something fascinating!). You’ll have a blast learning how to define characters by how they speak, and translating names, character descriptions and even songs and poems! Improve your creativity and let your words take players on a rollercoaster of emotions!


Game localization testing
You’d be amazed by the amount of errors that appear when the translated text is implemented in the game. This module teaches you to identify the main types of linguistic bugs and to write straightforward, useful and professional reports. Contribute to a successful translation by reporting bugs and improvements to polish the text until it’s perfect!
Are you ready to become a game localization professional? Then insert coin and… Let’s rock!

courses.description:
In this course we are going to be building out a classic style 2D RPG in the Godot engine with a top down perspective. The focus is on learning basic Godot concepts and related tools like Tiled which we can use to build out our game with playable game maps, level transitions, and movable - collidable game objects with kinematic physics from Godot. Having some programming knowledge will help to understand the core concepts. Whenever we approach a code piece, we'll go line by line in explaining and understanding what's going on under the hood. Some of the advantages of working with the Godot engine include that the engine is totally free and testing your game written in gdscript is very fast since it doesn't need to compile on every run. Gdscript is a python like language specific to Godot. This course was started with version 3.3.4 of Godot so I recommend using that version or above. The current 3.4 version seems to work good too.
Here's just some of the things you can expect to learn from this course!
Basics of Godot like understanding scenes, setting up your player input keys, and resizing the game window
Controlling animation state machine to pick movement animations and directions for your player
Adding in game objects and handling basic collisions
Setting up different animations for your player character based on sprite sheets
Basics of state machines and the idea of changing between different modes for your characters
Utilizing a follow camera to follow your player wherever it goes but staying within the limits of your game maps
Build 2D RPG levels with collisions, layer sorting, and level transitions
Use Tiled and Tiled to Godot Exporter to improve your level building process
Create a working 2D character controller with a follow camera

courses.bio: O caminho mais fácil e didático para você se tornar um game designer em pixel art.
objectives: Desenhar personagens em pixels de diferentes tamanhos.

A razão pelas quais os pixel arts de hoje são diferentes dos daqueles utilizados na terceira e quarta geração de videogames.
Por que ninguém faz mais pixel arts em formato SVGA - tais como os utilizados em Diablo, Warcraft 2 e Theme Hospital.
E muito mais.
requirements: Não há pré-requisitos. Qualquer pessoa pode aprender com esse curso.
courses.description:
No intervalo de tempo entre 1995 até meados de 2008 o mundo passou por uma explosão de jogos 3D. Essa nova forma de vivenciar os videogames era o novo zeitgeist. Todos falavam que jogos em 2D e ainda mais em pixel art eram coisas do passado. Era algo que seria relegado como uma herança que ficaria apenas nas memórias de quem viveu nesta época e que tiveram a oportunidade de desfrutar dos jogos que iam da primeira geração até a quarta e que timidamente adentrou em alguns jogos da quinta geração.

Entretanto, a partir de 2009 houve uma incrível explosão e revival de jogos em 2D em vetores e sobretudo em pixel art. Os jogos indies (jogos independentes) começaram a crescer no cenário gamer em todo o mundo. Dentro deste âmbito a figura de um novo designer surgia - o PIXEL ARTIST. Este seria agora o responsável por recriar mundos pixelizados que seriam o pano de fundo dos jogos indies de maiores sucessos. E mais, com o desenvolvimento de engines de desenvolvimento de games tais como a Unity, a Godot, RPG Maker, Construct e GDevelop, os jogos em pixel art conseguiram alcançar um patamar muito superior ao que era possível durante aos anos 1980 e 1990, em virtude dos limitados hardwares que tínhamos na época.

Sendo assim, esse curso se propõe a ensejar todos aqueles que querem dar os primeiros passos no desenvolvimento de games independentes. Ao aprender como criar personagens, cenários e objetos de composição em pixels, o designer poderá vislumbrar uma nova área de atuação que nunca imaginou antes ser possível. Cada vez mais o mercado de desenvolvimento de games necessita de designers capacitados para trabalhar. Como mercados emergentes e necessitados não apenas no Brasil bem como em vários países da Europa, o pixel artist pode encontrar trabalhos nas áreas de game designing.

Aqui, por conseguinte, você irá aprender a criar artes gráficas pixelizadas a partir do absoluto zero. Compreenderá amplamente como combinar cores, aprendendo a utilizar as melhores combinações com a teoria das cores. Entenderá diferentes estilos de pixel art. Conhecerá os estilos de game design de pixel art em 2D, tais como o side-scrolling, o top-down e o isométrico. Saberá porque artes pixelizadas em estilo SVGA são raramente utilizadas hoje em dia - e isso é algo que nenhum instrutor de pixel art ensina!

Irá aprender a construir personagens, cenários, objetos de composição e além disso, aprendenderá a animá-los - dando vida a eles. Definitivamente, um curso que busca desenvolver o pixel artista até o seu ápice.

requirements: Basic knowledge of Zbrush, 3ds Max, Substance Painter, Photoshop and Marmoset is required.
courses.description:
Instructor Info
Nikolay Naydenov is a Senior Character Artist currently working in Gameloft. Nikolay always had deep interest in art. In his spare time he was either reading a book or scribbling on a notebook ever since he was a child. He has been in the game industry since 2007 and had worked in many projects. The project that he is most proud of is the game titled March of Empires. He loves his job as a character artist especially when he is given freedom to do his own concepting and ideas. His advice for everyone just starting out is to spend lots of time learning software programs, be efficient and fast, and also spend many hours learning the anatomy, studying faces, and muscles underneath the skin. As every profession, to be good at something, you have to practice a lot. He recommends students to always look for improvement and never settle. He believes good things require sacrifice of time and other pleasures and this can turn your passion into a profession.
Course Info
In this course, you will learn how to make a low poly character from a high res mesh. First, we will start by exporting the high poly in parts, using the Decimation Master tool in Zbrush. Then we will import them in 3ds Max, and start making the low poly by retopologizing the decimated meshes. We will learn how to retopologize and make the most out of our forms with fewer polygons. Then we will make the UV coordinates for our low poly and bake the textures in Xnormal.  After that, our textures and low poly will be imported in Substance Painter, where you will learn how to make realistic metal, leather and other materials for your character texture. Then it will be time for Marmoset Toolbag, where we will make the most of our textures and model, to achieve the final result that we like. Last, but not least, we will learn how to make low poly hair from scratch. From making the hair planes brush in Zbrush, to making the texture and normal map from Fibermesh, and ready game hair in Marmoset.  The end result will be a beautiful production-ready game character.

Nous utiliserons également Substance 3D Painter, très populaire dans les grands studios de jeux vidéo, et nous nous appuierons sur les ressources gratuites de la librairie de Substance pour réaliser un meilleur texturing.
Sur Cinema 4D, vous découvrirez comment réaliser une composition intéressante avec des pièces, des cristaux et des lingots d'or, et comment réaliser un rendu avec Octane Render et peaufiner les effets visuels avec After Effects. Enfin, avec Unreal Engine, vous apprendrez à créer des matériaux en utilisant les textures optimisées de Substance 3D Painter. Ce dernier chapitre est important pour que vous puissiez assimiler les connaissances requises et reproduire le même aspect de vos texturings sur Unreal Engine.
Cette formation vous permettra de devenir indépendant dans vos projets personnels et professionnels et de libérer votre créativité.


Au programme de cet atelier pratique : réaliser le dépliage UV  avec Rizom UV, bien préparer ses objets 3D au texturing en anticipant l'optimisation, apprendre à importer et utiliser des ressources externes pour le texturing, réaliser une composition intéressante sur Cinema 4D en réalisant le rendu  avec Octane Render et After Effects pour les différents effets. Apprendre à Importer les textures optimisée et savoir créer les bon matériaux  pour du jeux vidéo avec Unreal Engine 5.1


Au programme de cet atelier pratique :
Réaliser un dépliage UV propre et soignée avec Rizom UV (ex Unfold),
Comment bien préparer ses objets 3D au texturing en anticipant l'optimisation,
Apprendre à importer et utiliser des ressources externes qui serviront à notre texturing,
Réaliser une composition intéressante directement sur Cinema 4D et réaliser un rendu et composition avec Octane Render et After Effects.
Cette formation dispose d'une page sur Artstation : Samuel Paire

Cyberpunk is a vibrant, exciting and neon drenched game environment appearing in more and more video games.
In this series I am going to show you a professional production process for creating both low poly and high poly modular game assets for creating a cyberpunk city for use in the Unity High Definition Render Pipeline (HDRP)
We will be modelling in Blender 2.82, where I will be showing you lots of cool techniques, shortcuts and best practices. We will be UV unwrapping the models to ensure we get high quality professional results.
We then jump over to Substance Painter 2019, one of the leading procedural texturing applications used in the game design industry today. I will be showing you how to create 4K multi layered materials that have that wow factor and the realism that is expected in today's game industry. We will also be covering opacity layers and emission channels for the neon glows.
Finally we take our optimised low poly 3D models with High Definition texture maps into Unity and set up and render a realistic scene using the HDRP settings in Unity which have some of the most realistic and impressive lighting and rendering capabilities in any game engine at the moment.
By the end of this course you will be very confident with making and texturing your own game objects. You will have an impressive piece you can include in your game design portfolios.
So why not enrol today and I look forward to seeing you in my course.

Saldrás de este viaje con un conocimiento único del diseño del diseño de videojuegos, ya no verás el diseño igual y ese conocimiento te acompañará haya donde vayas siempre y para siempre.

Hello! All right?
Welcome to yet another bland biography of an instructor!
My name is Gustavo Marcondes, and I'm one of those guys who are passionate about technology!
All of my initial training was all turned to educational psychology. I always dreamed of using the games to encourage our education. At first I wrote my first book (O LIVRO DAS LENDAS - Ed Zouk), an RPG to be used as a tutor in class. I've always been a fan of games. I had the opportunity to do some courses abroad that helped me a lot in the best understanding of programming, music and drawings for games 2d. So I combined educational psychology with techniques for 2d games.
Always living with social networks I realized that most of the contents presented in the network were directed to the programming of games. As always I was enchanted by art, I decided to launch a channel (GAME TEACHERS) with the intention of helping those who had no knowledge in drawing for 2d games. Teach from scratch with a unique methodology.
Now I decided to expand and deepen everything that had already been taught in the 60+ channel videos. In my courses, my main goal is that you not only learn how to draw 2D games, but have fun in the process!
For this, I use in my courses, the method that is based on the following principles:
- Learning in practice is much better and more enjoyable than with boring theoretical classes!
- Lessons do not need curling. How much more coaxing, more confusion and waste of time!
"There's no use knowing anything if you can not explain. Therefore, my didactics try to be as clear as possible!
If you are totally lay in art, you know nothing about drawing, but you dream of learning, you are in the right place.
If you already have some knowledge in drawing, but want to diversify it ... this course is also for you!
Now enough talk and let's get down to business!
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SOBRE O CURSO:
O curso se baseia em ensinar o Processo de Criação dos ASSETS necessários para a produção de arte para games 2d no estilo top down (visão de cima).
Num primeiro momento será apresentado a técnica de moldagem vetorial, capaz de transformar formas básicas nos mais diversos personagens. Também conhecerá e aprenderá a usar o software Gravit Designer e sua interface extremamente simples e intuitiva, o qual usaremos em todo o processo de criação.
Num segundo momento você vai aprender a desenhar cenários (backgrounds), os quais poderão ser usados para construir a base de um game top down.
Num terceiro momento você aprenderá a desenhar elementos (objetos que vão compor o cenário) do jogo, tais como tocha, vasos, chave, baú, etc.
Num quarto momento você já partirá para o aprendizado dos personagens. Você aprenderá a desenhar o herói e o vilão do jogo.
Num quinto momento você aprenderá as animações básicas (frame by frame) para os personagens: andando, atacando, morrendo, etc.
Num sexto momento você encontrará um material bônus com o exemplo de um efeito especial pronto para fazer download e ser usado durante o jogo.
*** Toda arte ensinada no curso estará disponível para baixar no formato do Gravit Designer (software que será usado para ensinar os desenhos durante todo o curso) e  também no formato SVG (permite que você o abra em qualquer outro software de desenho vetorial).
***** A cada passo você terá explicações claras e objetivas sobre tudo que está vendo. Seria como se eu estivesse ao seu lado numa conversa informal.
target_audience: O curso foi cuidadosamente criado para pessoas totalmente leigas em arte para jogos ou até desenvolvedores/programadores que queiram aprender a construção vetorial e animação de personagens para serem usados em seus futuros games 2d estilo top down.
Qualquer pessoa que queira aprender a criar arte vetorial.

courses.title: Next-Gen Weapon Modeling in 3ds Max
courses.bio: Learn the modeling techniques the pros use as we take you step-by-step through modeling this fantasy weapon!
objectives: Learn many of the tools and modifiers inside of 3ds Max to create this fantasy weapon
Learn pro tips on speeding up your workflow and polishing your work with today's game art standards in mind
requirements: Autodesk's 3ds Max
courses.description:
In this course, instructor Stephen G. Wells walks us through the creation of his Vampire Stake Launcher. His workflow covers various tools within the editable poly modifier such as edge extrusion, beveling, and slice planes, as well as the use of individual modifiers such as free form deformation lattices and symmetry to make the process easier. In addition, he will also cover the importance of smoothing groups while modeling, as well as make use of the kitbashing technique while reusing some elements that he has already created.
More about the Instructor:
Stephen Wells is an expert 3D modeler for characters, props, vehicles, weapons and environments and have created both high and low polygon assets for game productions. He has over 20 years experience in creating a variety of game assets for several different genres (fantasy, sci-fi, combat, superheroes, horror, etc) using 3ds Max, Maya, Photoshop, ZBrush, Mudbox, Topogun, and XNormal. As an enthusiastic instructor, he loves creating video tutorials on a wide variety of subjects to help students better their skillsets.
target_audience: Beginner-to-intermediate users who are already familiar with the basics of 3ds Max

courses.description:
¡Bienvenidos al curso de Game Design!
Podés encontrar muchos tuts gratuitos y complementarios en mi canal de Youtube.
Este curso ya no se va actualizar dado que los cursos gratuitos en Udemy tienen una duración máxima muy corta como para explicar en profundidad el game design.
Pueden ver mis vivos en Youtube y hacer consultas en el momento.
-
Cuando hablamos de diseño de juegos no estamos hablando de diseño gráfico ni de ilustración. El diseño de juegos o game design específicamente es el proceso de creación de las reglas y mecánicas de un juego en la etapa de preproducción; también es el diseño de la jugabilidad (gameplay), el ambiente, la historia y los personajes durante la etapa de producción.
En este curso les traigo una visión general muy breve de los elementos de game design que vemos en las clases que dicto en la universidad para las carreras "Diseño de videojuegos" o "Diseño de simuladores virtuales". También vamos a ver las dinámicas principales de los videojuegos, cómo crear experiencias enriquecedoras para los jugadores, la toma de decisiones y mucho más: estrategias, objetivos, niveles, puntos de spawn y respawn, dinámicas de juego, perfiles de usuario, etc.
Este curso es una guía para que puedas darle forma a esa idea que tenías dando vueltas.
Por favor no dejes de escribirme con tus sugerencias, tus consultas y tus opiniones acerca de tus proyectos y lo próximo que te gustaría ver en mis cursos.
Los cursos gratuitos en Udemy no pueden superar la duración de una hora. Por lo tanto si te parece que te quedaste con ganas de conocer más acerca de este increíble mundo del diseño de videojuegos no dudes en contactarme y visitar mis otros cursos.

courses.description:
Unreal Engine 5 Blueprint Fundamentals: Master Core Skills for Game Development
Unlock your potential as a game developer with Unreal Engine 5 Blueprint Fundamentals, a concise yet comprehensive course designed for aspiring creators eager to dive into Unreal Engine’s powerful visual scripting system. Whether you're a beginner looking to get started or someone seeking to solidify your foundation, this class is the perfect starting point to quickly build essential skills and gain hands-on experience in Unreal Engine 5.
In this beginner-friendly course, you’ll be guided through the core elements that form the backbone of game development using Unreal Engine. This class is structured to get you up and running fast, breaking down key concepts into manageable chunks with practical examples.
What You'll Learn:
Editor Tour: Start with a guided tour of the Unreal Engine 5 interface, helping you become familiar with the essential tools and layout you'll use throughout your game development journey.
Classes and Actors: Discover the fundamental building blocks of any Unreal Engine project, including how classes and actors interact to create dynamic and immersive gameplay.
Blueprint Basics: Dive into Unreal’s intuitive Blueprint scripting tool, learning how to create interactive game elements without writing a single line of code. You'll understand how Blueprints allow for fast iteration and prototyping, making game development accessible to everyone.
Variables and Actor Components: Learn how to store and manage game data using variables, and explore how Actor Components enhance the functionality of your game objects. These tools will help you structure and optimize your game’s logic efficiently.
Materials and Visuals: Gain a deeper understanding of materials and how they can be used to add texture, color, and realism to your in-game assets. Learn how to create stunning visuals that make your world come alive.
Input and Debugging: Master how to capture player input to create a responsive and interactive game. Additionally, you’ll learn essential debugging techniques to troubleshoot and ensure your game runs smoothly, minimizing errors.
Event Dispatchers: Unlock the power of Event Dispatchers to handle communication between different parts of your game, enabling better control over game flow and interactions between various game elements.
Why This Course Is Right for You:
Practical & Action-Oriented: This course focuses on the core skills you'll need to bring your game ideas to life, with hands-on examples that you can apply immediately to your projects.
Quick & Efficient Learning: The lessons are designed to be bite-sized, ranging from 7 to 15 minutes each, so you can quickly grasp key concepts and build upon them at your own pace.
Perfect for Beginners: If you’re new to Unreal Engine or game development, this course provides an accessible and non-overwhelming introduction to the engine's core functionalities.
Fast-Track Your Learning: Even if you're already familiar with Unreal Engine, this course offers an accelerated way to reinforce and deepen your understanding of Blueprints and other fundamental tools.
By the end of this course, you'll have a solid grasp of Unreal Engine 5's fundamental tools and techniques, empowering you to start developing your own games with confidence. Whether you're aiming to prototype your first game or expand your development skills, Unreal Engine 5 Blueprint Fundamentals will give you the foundation you need to succeed in the world of game development.
Join this class today and take your first step into the world of Unreal Engine 5 game development!
target_audience: Beginners wanting to code in Blueprint
Anyone interested in visual scripting and game logic.
Individuals seeking a practical introduction to Unreal.
Artists and designers who want to add interactivity.
Aspiring game developers new to Unreal Engine.

courses.description:
Nell’ambito di questo Corso di Game Writer svilupperai delle tecniche utili per scrivere e strutturare una storia. In particolare, si porrà attenzione allo storytelling implementato nei videogiochi e a come scrivere uno script adatto al gaming, compreso di cutscenes. Al termine del corso, sarai in grado di produrre una sceneggiatura professionale per un videogioco e di proporla a case di produzione di videogiochi. Inoltre, avrai le basi per lavorare autonomamente come game writer per sviluppare la tua sceneggiatura (script) e sarai in grado di presentare il tuo script alle aziende di game development o di lavorare con loro allo sviluppo della trama/sceneggiatura di un videogioco.


Il corso è strutturato in modo consequenziale, partendo da come è divisa una storia e la creazione della macrostruttura della trama del gioco, per poi spostarsi su come scrivere i personaggi (le loro personalità, la loro psicologia, le loro ambizioni), per poi parlare in dettaglio di come si scrivono i dialoghi e le cutscenes (quindi dei principi del game storytelling), fino alla scrittura della sceneggiatura (script) vero e proprio, contenente tutto ciò che ci serve per definire il design del nostro gioco.


Il Programma del Corso di Game Writer prevede le seguenti lezioni:


1 - La Struttura a Tre Atti di una Storia
2 - Caratterizzazione dei Personaggi e Archi Narrativi
3 - Dialoghi e Cutscenes
4 – Script e Storyboard Document
5 - Extra: Lezione Pratica di Scrittura di un Game Script

Adding different modular pieces & detail: adding more scanned assets & small lightning

requirements: already have experience with 3d modeling / texturing tools & unreal engine4
courses.description:
INTRODUCTION:
Welcome to the Game Environment Masterclass 2020 with Unreal Engine 4! This course is packed with expert insight, technical skills, secret tips, and the black arts of environment design that will help you level up your environment design and art skills to a whole new level! All Packed into a compact 45 hours of content that would be impossible to get anywhere else.


DESCRIPTION:

In this course, we will create a professional, next-gen-game environment using state of the art tools and resources
Here are few of the main points we’ll cover in this course:
- How to properly use Megascans and Unreal Engine 4 to create ray traced game environments
- Use tiled textures from Megascans to create modular pieces or custom pieces. We will make around 35-40 custom pieces using 3Dsmax and I will show you how, step-by-step.
- Setup a wide variety of advanced shaders in Unreal Engine 4
- Learn how to make every portion of the environment blend together very well to create a single seamless world
- How to properly use and reuse decals
- Using foliage to enhance the scene look by placing them in a smart way.
- Create custom masks for things like window glass using Substance Painter
- Learn how to customise Megascans PBR textures to make them more usable and to suit your environment
- How to enhance and carry out storytelling through your level design
- How to fake destroyed assets such as ruins of buildings and walls
- Use Unreal Engine’s Blueprints system to create splines tools that support both instancing and procedural meshes.
- Make sure the Blueprints tools we created are extensible and artist-friendly
- We will cover a bit of VFX and their shaders to help bring the scene to life
- Lighting is key to bring everything together and create truly beautiful worlds. You will learn how to beautifully light your scene and present it in the best possible way. You will also learn how to optimise lightning alongside ray tracing and post-process effects
- AND MUCH, MUCH MORE ...

The best way to describe this course is: become a one-man army. It’s not for beginners as I won’t cover the basics but if you’ve got a handle on artist tools then get strapped-in for quite the ride! There are no time lapse sequences and no pre-planned segments. Students will be able to follow me live digging my way to the end. I’ll be showing and explaining every little step along the way, allowing you to follow along in real-time or watch at your leisure.




WHO THIS COURSE IS FOR:
Intermediate game artists, level designers, game developers, or game designers
Unreal Engine users
Intermediate artists who want to learn game environment design
target_audience: intermediate game artists / developpers
Unreal Engine Users
intermediate 3d artist wants to learn game environment design

Kurs boyunca, App Inventor'ın kullanıcı dostu arayüzünü keşfedecek, sürükle ve bırak yöntemi ile blok tabanlı programlamayı öğreneceksiniz.

Kurs sonunda, kendi mobil uygulamalarınızı oluşturup, Android cihazlarınızda çalıştırabilecek seviyeye geleceksiniz. courses.description:
Introducing: ‘Blender 4: The Ultimate Environment Artist's Guide’!
We’ve been cooking up something extraordinary, and it's time to reveal the secret…!
Are you ready to take a stroll down the cobblestone alleys of design? Our BIGGEST, totally huge, and fantastic 40-hour course of the year is finally here.
‘Blender 4: The Ultimate Environment Artist's Guide’ will transport you to a bygone era, where Victorian elegance meets stylized graphics. Stay tuned for an immersive journey into 3D modelling that will have you crafting your very own piece of history.
‘Blender 4: The Ultimate Environment Artist's Guide’ is an advanced course designed for both new and experienced artists, focusing on 3D environmental creation in Blender with a specific emphasis on Victorian-era scenes.
The top 6 points about this course:
1. Storytelling through 3D Modelling: Design and tell a story of a Victorian street corner with intelligent colour management and signage
2. Entirely Blender-Created Scene: From Models to Shaders
3. Master Stylized Victorian Renders: In-Depth Compositor Setup Tutorial - Gain expert knowledge in producing stylized Victorian-style renders with a thorough breakdown of the full compositor setup
4. Enhance 3D Scenes with Realistic Window Displays: Simple Yet Effective Texture Techniques - Learn to enhance your 3D visuals, using straightforward plain textures to create captivating window displays that add depth and realism to your scenes
5. From Beginner to Pro: Progressive, Easy-to-Follow modelling section in a well-structured course about 3D modelling sections that gradually increase in complexity
6. Vertex Painting Mastery: Texturing Any Terrain Effectively - Discover the secrets to texturing any terrain convincingly and artistically using vertex painting
Key features of ‘Blender 4: The Ultimate Environment Artist's Guide’ include:
Victorian Era Scene Creation: Learn to craft detailed Victorian streetscapes, including elements like vintage trucks and streetlights, balancing historical accuracy and creativity.
Extensive Resource Pack: Access a variety of resources including geometry nodes, trees, shaders, and texture maps, and learn how to effectively incorporate these into your scenes. This massive resource pack comes with around 50 shaders, 3 custom geometry nodes you won't find anywhere else, and of course our trusted human scaled model, providing an unparalleled toolkit for your creations.
Progressive Learning Curve: ‘Blender 4: The Ultimate Environment Artist's Guide’ is structured to guide learners from basic 3D modelling to complex, professional techniques.
Reference Art, Greyboxing, and Edgewear Techniques: Master the art of referencing and greyboxing, and learn to apply edgewear and realistic textures to your models. A fully comprehensive guide to referencing is included, guiding you through traditional methods like using Pinterest and Google but also innovative approaches utilizing AI tools such as ChatGPT and Midjourney for inspiration and accuracy in design.
Shader, Texture, and Compositing Mastery: Dive deep into the creation and application of shaders and textures and learn comprehensive compositing skills using Blender's render engines.
Working with the Blender compositor to turn any scene into a professional piece is part of this course too! ‘Blender 4: The Ultimate Environment Artist's Guide’ will introduce you to techniques like layering with AO and emission node setups, as well as enhancing the environment and warmth of your scene, all through the Blender 4 compositor.
Advanced Camera Techniques: Become proficient with Blender’s camera settings and learn how to effectively set up multiple camera setups to enhance composition.
A complete camera turntable guide ensures you'll never be stuck again on rendering turntables, understanding what makes for good composition.
Lighting Mastery: Learn advanced lighting techniques for adding mood and realism to your scenes. Using the Blender Sky Texture node setup, you will gain control over your lighting within your projects, all done in Blender without the need for outside resources.
Vertex Painting Mastery: Discover the secrets to texturing any terrain convincingly and artistically using vertex painting, empowering you to create more dynamic and engaging 3D environments.
‘Blender 4: The Ultimate Environment Artist's Guide’ will have you mastering the art of stylized Victorian architecture.
Think quaint bookshops, cosy inns, and mysterious alleyways that could only exist in a world crafted by your hands.
Your Blender 4 stylized Victorian scene will include:
· A perfume shop with an ornate façade, offering an array of delicate fragrances, captured in miniature digital bottles. A bustling coffee shop with large, welcoming windows, inviting passersby to savour a moment of reprieve.
· A book shop filled with rows of finely textured tomes, each spine a gateway to another world.
· A traditional butcher with its distinctive red and white striped awning, promising the finest cuts for a Victorian feast.
· A subway entrance, a portal to the throbbing heart of this digital city, complete with period-specific signage.
· Newspaper stands at the corner - a small yet pivotal model that tells of the day's events with its array of miniature papers.
The textures give authenticity to shop fronts, the lighting that reflects the mood of an early morning rush, and the props that speak of the everyday lives of your city's inhabitants.
‘Blender 4: The Ultimate Environment Artist's Guide’ is not just about building models; it's about creating stories and setting scenes that resonate with the soul of the Victorian era. It is packed with tips, tricks, and detailed walkthroughs to elevate your portfolio to new heights all in Blender 4.
So, dust off your virtual tools, and prepare for an adventure in modelling!


Summing it all up


Imagine an old city quarter, where each building tells a story steeped in Victorian lore, and every brick is a testament to your growing skills. We're not just creating models; we're breathing life into the streets of the past.
Picture the intricate roofing, the bay windows, and the quaint shopfronts that will come alive!
Taking Blender 4 a step further with this new exciting project, ‘Blender 4: The Ultimate Environment Artist's Guide’:
· Master the Art of Starting Right: Discover the essential techniques to kickstart any project effectively with our comprehensive greybox and lighting guide.
o Learn how to plan and visualise your ideas, ensuring a solid foundation for your 3D creations.
· Elevate Your Modeling Skills: Take your modelling abilities to the professional level with our extensive course.
o Dive deep into advanced modelling secrets used by industry experts and gain the confidence to tackle complex 3D projects.
· Create Stunning Victorian Structures: Unleash your creativity with Geometry Nodes and craft breathtaking Victorian-era structures.
o Learn how to use procedural modelling to design intricate architectural details, making your scenes truly unique.
· Unlock the Power of Blender 4 Shaders: Explore the Blender 4 shader set and witness your creations come to life with incredible materials.
o Gain in-depth knowledge of shader creation, texturing, and rendering techniques to make your models shine.
· Stand Out with Compositing: Elevate your renders to the next level as you master the Blender 4 compositor.
o Learn the art of post-processing and compositing, ensuring your 3D artworks stand out in any portfolio or presentation.
Get ready to push the boundaries of your imagination and set your creativity ablaze!


Your Blender 4 stylized Victorian scene will include:
· A perfume shop with an ornate façade, offering an array of delicate fragrances, captured in miniature digital bottles. A bustling coffee shop with large, welcoming windows, inviting passersby to savour a moment of reprieve.
· A book shop filled with rows of finely textured tomes, each spine a gateway to another world.
· A traditional butcher with its distinctive red and white striped awning, promising the finest cuts for a Victorian feast.
· A subway entrance, a portal to the throbbing heart of this digital city, complete with period-specific signage.
· Newspaper stands at the corner - a small yet pivotal model that tells of the day's events with its array of miniature papers.
The textures give authenticity to shop fronts, the lighting that reflects the mood of an early morning rush, and the props that speak of the everyday lives of your city's inhabitants.


‘Blender 4: The Ultimate Environment Artist's Guide’ is not just about learning 3D modelling techniques; it's a journey to becoming a professional environment artist, with a special focus on the enchanting and complex world of Victorian-era design.


Until next time, happy modelling everyone!

Neil – 3D Tudor

courses.description:
En este completísimo curso verás como funcionan las técnicas y herramientas de modelado y sculpting y a aplicarlas en tu propio trabajo, tendrás unas bases del manejo del programa Cinema 4d y verás como usarlo para darle vida a tus ideas.
Esos conocimientos, serán totalmente aplicables a cualquier otro software como 3d Studio Max, Maya, Blender, Zbrush... y a cualquier campo del diseño 3d como por ejemplo el cine, los videojuegos o la ilustración.
Aprenderás a pensar y planificar tu flujo de trabajo antes de actuar, a solucionar cualquier problema que te pueda suceder en un ámbito profesional para luego poder proceder de una manera rápida, sencilla y efectiva.
No hace falta que hayas tocado nunca Cinema 4d u otro programa de 3d, tampoco conocimientos técnicos o artísticos previos (aunque es recomendable), con unos conocimientos de informática básica (y te recomiendo una tableta gráfica para la parte del sculpting) te vale para completar el curso sin mayores dificultades.
Como siempre recuerda que puedes contactarme para cualquier duda que tengas, incluso puedes formar parte de una comunidad exclusiva donde incluso puedes compartir tus trabajos y tus avances con el curso, me encantaría verlos.
Espero que disfrutes mucho del curso, mínimo tanto como yo creándolo, que aprendas mucho, te aseguro que  va a valer mucho la pena, si hay algo que te gustaría aprender no dudes en hacérmelo saber, así todos salimos ganando, tú, yo y los futuros alumnos que vayan viniendo aquí, sobre todo estamos para aprender, no lo olvides.

様々な高度なサウンド機能を備えているUnreal Engine 4。しかしWebや書籍では序盤しか触れられていなかったり、一貫した情報がまとまっていません。その上にアセットのパラメータも多い上に名前の由来に分かりにくいものがあるなど、使いこなすまでの道のりが遠いとお悩みの方も多いのではないでしょうか？このコースはそんな方々のために用意したUnreal Engine 4のサウンド機能を使いこなせるようになるためのショートカットようなものです。
このコースはブループリントを使ってサウンドプログラミングを行えるようになるのが目的ではなく、ブループリントから呼び出される各種サウンドアセットの機能と活用方法を学ぶコースになります。この初級～中級編ではSoundCue、SoundAttenuation（サウンド減衰）、SoundMix、SoundConcurrency（サウンドの並列処理）、ReverbEffectの使い方を学びます。

Unreal Engine 4のサウンド機能のもう１つの弱点はサウンドクリエイターだけではその機能の検証や調整がやりにくいという点が挙げられると思います。このコースではチェックや調整、機能確認などの方法もレクチャーします。
ここを抑えることで受講者自身でゲームサウンドをより高品位に高めていくことができるようになります。またUnreal Engine 4以外のゲームエンジンやオーディオミドルウェアでも共通した概念が随所に出てきますので、一般的なゲームサウンドの制作手法についても学ぶことができます。またOculus Audio Pluginを使った立体音響やその他VRコンテンツの制作に役立つノウハウも含んでおり幅広く応用できる内容になっています。

コース自体はWindows10で進みますが、Macでも進められる内容になっています。

courses.description:
Robloxer志望、ここにあつまれ！


「blenderを学んできたけど、いまいち仕事に繋がらない」
そんなあなたの為のプロフェッショナル人材育成講座シリーズです。


ゲーム版YouTubeとも謳われ、全世界で２億人超のユーザーに親しまれるRoblox。現在は開発ツールの民主化が進み、「ゲーム開発は一部の専門家だけが成せるもの」という時代は終わりました。ゲームとして遊ぶだけでなく、あなたが開発者となってゲームや空間のデザインに取り組み、想像した世界を創造主となることができます。


それだけではなく、Robloxにはコミュニティを熱源にした活気と、経済圏が存在します。この講座は、「Robloxをイチから学び、Roblox開発の仕事を請けられる技能を身につけ、世界に羽ばたくRobloxer」を育成する講座シリーズ、そのBackgroundクリエイター育成編です。Robloxの開発を行うためのツール RobloxStudioを中心に、必須スキルとなるblenderのモデリングテクニックとテクスチャリングをレクチャーし、プロ人材認定を目的としています。


※本講座はプロ人材育成・認定を目的としたコースですので、blenderの基礎知識を必要とします。blender未経験の方は、【Robloxプロフェッショナル講座】3Dモデリング〜RobloxStudio&blender入門編〜からのエントリーをおすすめします。


【Robloxのクリエイター領域と仕事】
一言にゲーム開発と知ってもその領域は様々です。大きくはゲーム・遊びをつくるプログラミング、世界観を構築する空間デザインに２分され、空間デザインに関わるクリエイターの例として、以下の３つがあります。


１．Prop Creator
Propと呼ばれる小物作づくりができるクリエイターです。blenderのようなDCC(Digital Content Creation)ツールを使用してモデリング、テクスチャリングを行い、形と見た目を表現します。Roblox


2．Background Creator
一般に背景制作やワールド構築と呼ばれる空間全体のデザインを行います。RobloxStudioに標準搭載されている機能を広く活用して素早く効率的に構築することが求められます。モデリングの知識にとどまらず、各種エフェクトの扱いなど総合的な知識も求められるでしょう。


3．Avatar Creator
キャラクターの動きを考えたり、キャラクターの着る服やアクセサリーをデザインしたりするクリエイターです。基本的に「動く」ことを考慮してモデルを用意する能力や専用のエディタの専門知識を要します。


それぞれの分野にそれぞれの専門性・仕事があり、この講座シリーズでは仕事が請けられるレベルの知識を身につけることを目標とした濃密な講座を用意しています。


【この講座で学べること＆カリキュラム】

その他、多数実践的なノウハウをお届けします。


さぁ、世界へ羽ばたくRoblox開発人材を目指し、このコースでスタートを切りましょう！

requirements: There are no prerequisites for this course, anyone can complete it :)
courses.description:
We'll give you a brief introduction to game design and explain everything you need to know as a beginner. We've created the course for people who want to participate in our Game Jam, however, it is also suitable for beginners who want to know more about game design and get a hands on start in some of the platforms that are frequently used. This course covers 5 important concepts to know about game design, 10 principles of level design, interpreting the feeling of progression, music theory for gaming, the use of Bosca Ceoil for soundtracks and the use of Pixil Art for pixel asset design. After the completion of this course, you will be eligible to understand the design principles of a simple game for Game Jam. We highly encourage you to further your knowledge in game design after completing this course. We also encourage you to leave a constructive feedback so that this course could be updated and improved. This course is followed by the course on Unity game development and coding which will be available soon.


**** If you are interested in game design and development, you may want to join to HisarCS Game Jam and practice your knowledge. (Visit our website for more information) *****

courses.description:
Master Game Design & Decision-Making with Praxeology!


Want to create engaging, immersive games that captivate players? Struggling to understand how players make decisions? Looking for a powerful framework to shape player behavior?


This practical and insightful course dives deep into game design and human decision-making using Praxeology the science of human action!


What You'll Learn:
The Fundamentals of Game Design Understand what makes a game truly engaging. Why There Is No Single Definition of a Game – Learn how gaming is a state of mind! How Praxeology Applies to Game Design Use logical frameworks to predict player choices. The Axioms of Human Action Discover the principles guiding every in-game decision. How to Influence Player Behavior Design games that evoke strong emotional responses.


Who Is This Course For?
Game Designers  Master decision-making mechanics and player psychology. Developers & Indie Creators Build games that truly resonate with players. UX & Behavioral Designers – Apply game theory to enhance user engagement. Marketers & Monetization Experts Understand how players think to increase retention.


Why This Course?
Short & Impactful – Designed for practical learning with real applications. No Fluff, Just Value  Straight to the point with powerful insights. Expert Instructor  Learn from an experienced game consultant.


Start using praxeology to design better games today! Enroll now!
target_audience: Understand Human Decision-Making in Games: Equip students with knowledge about how players make decisions and how psychology influences game mechanics and player experiences

objectives: Aprenda desde a manipulação de uma imagem até a animação total de personagens para jogos 2d e projetos, produzindo folhas de sprites otimizadas e profissionais.
Programas GIMP e SPRITER PRO, use os para produzir folhas de sprites profissionais. Aprenda a configurar, a interface e principais ferramentas destes programas.
Receba vasto material de apoio, com imagens exclusivas de personagens diversos para você criar suas próprias folhas de sprites, não é preciso saber desenhar.

requirements: O aluno não precisa saber desenhar ou ter dótes artísticos, pois neste curso, todo o material de imagens necessário será fornecido e a manipulação até a finalização da folha de sprites será ensinada passo a passo através dos programas Gimp e Spriter Pro.

É necessário ter noções básicas de uso de computador ou notebook. Conhecimentos como: Uso de teclado e mouse, uso de navegador de internet, instalação básoca de programas, salvamento e organização básica de arquivos, etc... enfim, apenas o básico, se você tem costume usar computador e notebook, já deve ter esses conhecimentos.

GIMP - O programa Gimp é um poderoso programa para manipular e criar imagens. Ele é gratuíto. Usamos a versão 2.10 no curso, mais não se preocupe se você instalar uma versão mais recente, pois há poucas diferênças. Acesse o site do gimp, baixe e instale para fazer o curso.

Spriter Pró: Você precisa do Spriter na sua versão Pro para aproveitar o curso, pois a versão de teste não tem todos os recursos de animação necessários. Compre uma licença, baixe e instale em seu computador para fazer o curso. DICA: Compre pela steam, que é substancialmente mais barato.

Inteligência Artificial: Demonstraremos como podemos utilizar a inteligência artificial para conseguir imagens otimizadas para transformar em personagens animados com as técnicas ensinadas no curso, porém, NÃO são necessárias qualquer assinatura ou licença de programas de geração de imagens por inteligência artificial, já que há um vasto material de imagens fornecidas no curso. Apenas citaremos a Inteligência artificial como uma possivel maneira de conseguir imagens.
courses.description: Neste curso, transformaremos uma imagem estática em um personagem animado, e depois, em uma folha de sprites otimizada, utilizando os programas Gimp e o Spriter Pro. Realizaremos o aprendizado e manipulação da imagem de um personagem 2D, passo a passo, com o programa gratuito GIMP, e faremos a produção das animações com o Programa Spriter Pro (Programa de animação 2d de melhor custo benefício do mercado) e, em seguida, exportaremos um personagem utilizável em jogos e projetos 2d, contendo várias animações através de uma Folhas de Sprites (Sprite Sheet) profissional, recurso cobiçado pelas equipes e desenvolvedores de jogos e projetos 2d, que podem ser usadas nos seus próprios jogos ou fazer parte de packs de material para o mercado de desenvolvimento de games. Não é necessário saber desenhar ou ter dotes artísticos, pois trabalharemos com manipulação de imagens, não criação, sendo fornecido um vasto roll de imagens no material complementar, que você poderá usar para criar outras folhas de sprites com as técnicas ensinadas neste curso. Ainda te mostrarei como utilizo a Inteligência Artificial como aliada desta técnica, na criação imagens (matéria prima) para aplicar as técnicas do curso, e falaremos sobre alguns sites onde você pode expor seu material. Não perca tempo e dê um grande passo para se tornar um profissional da área dos games com este curso. Te vejo durante as aulas. Até breve!
target_audience: Iniciantes, intermediários e profissionais interessados em animação de personagens 2d para jogos (games) e projetos;
Interessados em aprender otimização e criação de folhas de sprites profissionais com os programas GIMP e Spriter Pro.
Interessados em aprender, do básico ao avançado, a fazer animação de personagens 2d com o Spriter Pro.

objectives: Compreender os fundamentos de shaders e materiais: Aprender sobre a teoria por trás dos shaders e como eles interagem com a luz para criar efeitos visuais.
Dominar o editor de materiais da Unreal Engine: Navegar pela interface do editor, criar e modificar materiais, e utilizar os nós e funções disponíveis.
Criar materiais personalizados: Desenvolver materiais para diversos tipos de superfícies, como metais, madeira, líquidos, etc., utilizando texturas e máscaras.

courses.description:
Mergulhe no fascinante mundo dos shaders e materiais e transforme seus projetos visuais em experiências inesquecíveis. Neste curso completo e abrangente, você aprenderá a criar materiais personalizados que irão dar vida aos seus mundos virtuais.
Do básico ao avançado, você explorará os fundamentos dos shaders, a interface do editor de materiais da Unreal Engine e técnicas avançadas para criar materiais fotorealistas e estilizados. Descubra como utilizar mapas de textura, efeitos de iluminação, pós-processamento e muito mais para alcançar resultados visuais impressionantes.
Conteúdo do Curso:
Fundamentos de Shaders: Compreenda a teoria por trás dos shaders e como eles interagem com a luz para criar diferentes efeitos visuais.
Editor de Materiais da Unreal Engine: Domine a interface do editor, crie e modifique materiais, e utilize os nodes e funções disponíveis para alcançar resultados personalizados.
Mapas de Textura: Aprenda a utilizar diferentes tipos de mapas (difusa, normal, metalicidade, rugosidade, etc.) para criar materiais realistas e variados.
Efeitos de Iluminação: Explore técnicas avançadas de iluminação, como reflexos, refração, iluminação global e sombras, para criar cenas mais imersivas.
Efeitos Especiais: Crie efeitos visuais incríveis, como partículas, névoa, volumetria e distorções, para dar vida aos seus projetos.
Otimização: Aprenda a otimizar seus materiais para garantir o melhor desempenho em tempo real, sem comprometer a qualidade visual.

Este curso está especialmente diseñado para que el estudiante pueda dominar los elementos de un videojuego 3D profesional tipo plataforma en Unity y con el lenguaje C#.

Aprenderás con la técnica "Aprende mientras creas" y está dividido en secciones específicas para que el estudiante pueda aprender desde cero, o para que pueda localizar soluciones detalladas para añadir elementos profesionales a tus videojuegos.

A su vez, el curso cuenta con todos los recursos necesarios para que el estudiante pueda desarrollar completamente el ejercicio, así como con “retos para el estudiante” para que pueda poner en práctica lo aprendido a través de cada una de las secciones.
El instructor cuenta con amplia experiencia en la enseñanza de Desarrollo de videojuegos y animación en Instituciones educativas y Universidades del norte de México, así como certificado profesional en Autodesk Maya y como “trainer” certificado de Reallusion y estará brindándote apoyo en tu proceso de aprendizaje.

courses.description:
Welcome to my new course where we will be Making a Mario Kart style racing game in Unity 6.
I will take you step by step through the process of creating a complete game from start to finish.
Beginner to Intermediate level coding
We write our own code throughout the game and look in detail at writing code  specifically for racing cars and karts. This also covers computer controlled AI karts that challenge you to a competitive race.
What we create
The course features three cartoony race tracks. The first track we create ourselves from scratch, covering track design using Unity splines. Asset layout and animated obstacles.
The karts have special items such as boxing gloves so you can punch the opponents out of the way when they are too close. Missiles so you can blow up karts that are up ahead of you. Cartoon bombs that can blow up karts behind you and oil splats that will cause opponents to spin out and lose control.
Single player and local multiplayer
We use the Unity Input System, so you can control the kart using keyboard and mouse, or gamepad. We create a local multiplayer mode for 2, 3 or 4 local players. Note that this isn't online multiplayer, but local multiplayer where up to 4 players can use the same computer to race against each other.
Develop game design and coding skills
By the end of this course you will have developed skills and knowledge to make your own awesome driving games and have a completed game for your portfolio of work. The end product is yours and you can share it with friends or even upload online.
You don't need any previous game design experience as I take you through it step by step. You can of course continue to add your own ideas, tracks, cars and assets to this project. If you get stuck just drop me a message in the Q & A section and I'll help you get everything sorted.
Why not enrol today and I look forward to seeing you in the course.
target_audience: This course is for people wanting to make their own games in Unity 6
You should have a passion for game design
This features level design and coding, so is suitable for all people interested in game design

courses.bio: Aprenda tudo sobre Iluminação com Luz Direcional, Point, Spot, Área, Reflection e Group Prob
requirements: Ter um aparelho que rode a unity
Querer aprender! todos podem! o curso é bem explicado e fácil de entender!
courses.description:
Iluminação profissional para games Unity 2022 é um curso onde o aluno aprender a utilizar os vários recursos de iluminação do Unity de forma avançada, aprendendo sobre todas as opções de edição, incluindo intensidade, distancia, cor, realismo obtido ao definir determinadas configurações de iluminação com HDR.


Os recursos de iluminação oferecidos pelo Unity são muito poderosos, mas em raras vezes vemos eles sendo utilizadas com seu poder real, um game que posso citar que conseguiu esse resultado é Holow King.


Recursos de iluminação como Recurso de Iluminação Direcional fornece poderosa iluminação ilimitada em termos de espaço, mas limitada em termos de rotação, sendo uma ferramenta comumente utilizada para iluminação geral de cenários(cenários com alta iluminação e sem ambientação de luzes com occlusion). É uma ferramenta muito poderosa por ter alcance ilimitado, porem a iluminação forte fornece perda de detalhes, sendo extremamente recomendado seu uso com cautela, com uma intensidade fraca, no máximo 1. A ferramenta é mais poderosa em nível de sombreamento, consegue produzir sobras realmente deslumbrantes, isso é dado sua iluminação poderosa e direcional, mas os efeitos negativos estão também, perda de detalhes! não há como evitar 100% isso usando essa ferramenta!


Recurso de Iluminação como Recurso de Iluminação Point Light é uma iluminação de Ponto, ou seja, ilumina apenas no alcance definido aquilo que esta ao redor do ponto, é muito comum o uso do Draw no Point pra produzir aquele efeito em área de outro mundo, Holow King realmente abusou deste efeito!!! cup head usou também, Rogue Legacy 1 e 2 utilizou esse efeito em todas as luzes do mapa 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 e 6, também usou para produzir ou realçar alguns poderes de área, poderes que ficavam se movendo na cena com iluminação forte de efeito(como o poder do chefe do mapa 4, ao usar um poder roxo que rotacionava)!


Recursos de Iluminação como Recurso de Iluminação Spot Light é uma ferramenta de iluminação direcional, com uma direção circular que aumenta conforme a distancia e o ângulo(podemos alterar isso a vontade na ferramenta), essa ferramenta pode ser muito poderosa no game se usada corretamente em situações especificas, como para iluminar a região em que o personagem está caminhando em um ambiente escuro, muito utilizado em games de terror e horror, também para chamar atenção do personagem para um lugar especifico, é bastante usada também em games com vigilância(onde o personagem deve se mover sem ser detectado pelos inimigos), nessas situações é configurada em código o spot junto com a movimentação do inimigo(normalmente) para que caso o player caminhe no campo de visão do inimigo(a parte iluminada com spot) o playe possa ser detectado e perseguido.


Reflection Probe é uma ferramenta utilizada em algumas situações bem especiais em game, seu uso não é tão frequente e configura-lo de forma a fazer um efeito visível é realmente desafiador! A ferramenta tem como uso normal ser utilizada para criação de materiais através da produção de cubmaps! seu efeito é em todas as direções e ele realiza essa captura utilizando a câmera! não há conteúdo de criação de materiais no curso, apenas iluminação!!


Light Prob Group é uma ferramenta profissional e avançada que é utilizada para produzir efeitos de alta qualidade de iluminação, sua iluminação usando Point causa efeitos surreais de qualidade mais alta! seu uso consome mais recursos, é um recurso múltiplo de iluminação!  é recomendado seu uso em regiões mais importantes do game! como na iluminação do próprio personagem, e especialmente é extremamente recomendado seu bom uso em locais com grande beleza em nível de cenário, para junto com essa iluminação, derrubar o queixo do gamer!
target_audience: Para todos que querem aprender a utilizar sistemas profissionais de iluminação em games
Para todos que querem utilizar luz em ambientes com oclusion

courses.title: Learn Concepting and Character Design with Photoshop
courses.bio: Learn to Design an awesome character for video games and other media.
objectives: Design characters

requirements: Students will need access to Photoshop
courses.description:
This course will cover the design phase of one character meant for a video game production and transferable to other media, from first conception to fully rendered splash or key art for promotional purposes. Students will learn how to initially thumbnail a design before taking it to a rough and then finalized front/back character rotation, including this character’s costume and equipment. Further exploration into this character’s backstory and personality will also result in several design sheets. These include an expression sheet, passive acting pose sheet and action pose sheet. Students will also later delve further into development of this character’s in-game costume and equipment, and even be introduced to producing basic thumbnails or keyframes to explore how this character may move during gameplay or combat. Finally, students will be introduced to a simple, step by step method that will take them from thumbnail phase to a finished, polished and full colour render of their character. This final volume covers everything from nailing down a solid pose, dynamic composition, colour choices and preparing the image to be painted. A series of lighting and shadow passes, followed by a detailed polish and special effects step will complete the illustration. Upon completing this series, the student will have an in-depth glimpse into what it takes to design a single character for video games or other media.
More about the Instructor:

Colin Searle is a Designer and Illustrator living in Toronto and working fulltime as a designer for Elliott Animation, currently taking on freelance and client work from studios like Ubisoft and several others. He likes to exercise and draw, and he's not sure which one he likes doing more!
